intro: Draba howellii, commonly known as Howell's whitlow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This low-growing perennial is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in alpine or arctic environments. Its compact size and ability to survive in harsh climates make it an important part of its native ecosystem.
